intro: Phacelia sinuata, commonly known as the sinuous phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks. It has a short growing season and is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phacelia sinuata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
